alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:52PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL, NORTHWESTERN DE BACA, WEST CENTRAL QUAY AND EASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Variadero to 12 miles northwest of Yeso. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Montoya, Yeso, Conchas Lake State Park, Conchas Dam, Puerto De Luna, Newkirk, Santa Rosa Lake State Park, Cuervo and Conchas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 272 and 313. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 283 and 316. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 51 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Quay County
